Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Credibility of applicant's education and work history
Crimes.Review_Court: Federal Court (implied by judicial review context)
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of immigration officer’s decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Adverse credibility finding due to inconsistencies
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Conflicting education and work histories in application documents
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA sections related to skilled worker eligibility and credibility assessment
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Insufficient points and lack of credible work/education history
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: IRPA Regulations applicable to skilled worker applications
Crimes.Application_Error: Inconsistent reporting of education and employment details
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Patent unreasonableness standard applied to credibility findings
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None noted – officer considered all submitted information
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refusal of permanent residence application upheld
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the officer erred in credibility assessment
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA provisions on admissibility and skilled worker criteria
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Inconsistencies in education and work experience details
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections concerning misrepresentation and credibility
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Assessed during judicial review; no breach found
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not alleged – issue centered on misrepresentation through inconsistency
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant challenged reasonableness of credibility finding
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Compliance with procedural fairness in decision-making

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Credibility of applicant's education and work experience
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) and Regulations
Crimes.Review_Court: Federal Court (implied by judicial review context)
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of immigration officer’s decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Adverse credibility finding due to significant discrepancies
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Conflicting information about education and work experience in China
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA and Regulations governing skilled worker applications
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Failure to meet eligibility criteria due to credibility concerns
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Discrepancies in education and employment history
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: IRPA Regulations for skilled worker category
Crimes.Application_Error: Provided conflicting details in student permit vs. permanent residence applications
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: No evidence ignored – decision based on inconsistencies in provided information
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether credibility assessment was patently unreasonable
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA provisions on false representation and skilled worker requirements
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Inconsistencies in education and employment history
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA and associated regulations on representation and eligibility
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not directly alleged – focus on false statements
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of credibility determination
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Fairness and reasonableness of decision process
Crimes.Omission_Type: Inconsistent reporting rather than complete omission
